posts.name: Tom Winter
posts.cooked:
We had been having network issues at our last competition whenever our robot was rebooted, potentially related to Shuffleboard, so we made the switch to Elastic and are now having similar, but different issues. I tried to make it really simple and create a project with the just the following few lines of code and tried running it in my simulator (on a mac).

When the Elastic dashboard first connects to this code, the Combo Box chooser works great, but then if the robot code is stopped / restarted (without closing Elastic), the Elastic combos will display a red exclamation mark and it will never connect with the code (and autoProgram.getSelected() returns the wrong value) until I change the value in the dashboard, and then it syncs.

If I open AdvantageScope while the red exclamation mark is showing and connect to the Simulator, it shows the the “selected” entry for that ComboBox is blank, so it seems to be an issue with Elastic not reconnecting to the NetworkTables.

Is this normal?  Or am I missing some code that is needed to cause the elastic combo boxes to reconnect on code restart?

We have the newest WPILIB (2025.3.2) and had this same version for our last competition.

link_counts.title: Elastic 2025: A Lot of Little Things

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
There was an Elastic release today to fix this/similar issue.

Elastic 2025: A Lot of Little Things Programming

link_counts.title: Elastic 2025: A Lot of Little Things

posts.name: Tom Winter
posts.cooked:
After installing that patch, the behavior has changed, but it still does not work correctly.

Using the same code above with the new Elastic version 2025.2.1:  Now, when the code is stopped / restarted (without closing Elastic), the Elastic combos will display a green checkmark, and if I call autoProgram.getSelected(), I will get the correct value. However, when I change the value in the combo box, it then displays a red exclamation mark and the value of autoProgram.getSelected() does not change to the new value.

If I look at AdvantageScope after restarting code, the “selected” property still does not get assigned until the value is changed in the combo box.

posts.name: Nadav
posts.cooked: I can’t seem to reproduce the issue you are seeing (in sim that is), do you have any other programs connected to network tables?

posts.name: Scott W
posts.cooked: We’re having the exact same problem.  You have to restart Elastic to get it to select the autonomous routine (often but not necessarily every time).  We inadvertently ran an autonomous routine instead of a wheel test autonomous routine in our pit this weekend because of this.  We had it up on blocks, but it did move the arm unexpectedly.  This is why you clear everyone from around your robot before enabling.

posts.name: Tom Winter
posts.cooked:
I rebooted my laptop this morning to make sure no processes were still running.  I am still having this issue. Here are my steps I took to reproduce this issue:

Reboot laptop

Open Visual Studio with the following code:

Simulate Robot Code (Sim GUI=yes, Use Real DriverStation=no)

Start Tool / Elastic

Elastic / Clear layout

Add Widget, drag “Auto Program” to dashboard

Auto Program now shows “Option 1” and a green checkmark

Change Auto Program to “Do Nothing”

Auto Program now shows “Do Nothing” and a green checkmark

Stop simulation, but leave Elastic open

Wait 5-10 seconds

Simulate Robot Code

Auto Program now shows “Do Nothing” and a green checkmark

Change Auto Program to “Drive Out”

Auto Program now shows “Drive Out” and a red exclamation mark

Wait several minutes

Auto Program still shows “Drive Out” and a red exclamation mark

Start Tool / AdvantageScope

AdvantageScope / Connect to Simulator

AdvantageScope shows this:

AdvantageScope1 608×626 41.9 KB )

AdvantageScope1 608×626 41.9 KB

AdvantageScope1 608×626 41.9 KB

Stop simulation and stop AdvantageScope, but leave Elastic open

Wait 5-10 seconds

Simulate Robot Code

Auto Program now shows “Drive Out” and a green checkmark

Start Tool / AdvantageScope

AdvantageScope / Connect to Simulator

AdvantageScope shows this:

AdvantageScope2 602×608 39.9 KB

AdvantageScope2 602×608 39.9 KB

AdvantageScope2 602×608 39.9 KB

posts.name: Nadav
posts.cooked:
I’m still not able to get the exact scenario you’re describing, it always seems to update properly for me.

Could you reproduce this again but have Elastic in trace mode? If you go to the app settings, Developer (Advanced) , you can change the log level to trace. After reproducing in trace mode, you can find the log in C:\Users\<user>\AppData\Roaming\com.gold872\elastic_dashboard

Also, can you try this but with a chooser that isn’t used anywhere? Just a SendableChooser with a few options, but isn’t interacted with anywhere in the code except at startup. This would rule out the possibility that there’s an issue in your robot code.

posts.name: Nadav
posts.cooked: Sorry, didn’t realize you put the code example there. I was able to reproduce the issue and am looking into it right now. I’ll keep you updated on my findings. Thanks for reporting this!

posts.name: Nadav
posts.cooked:
The issue has been identified and resolved, a release will be posted shortly

The old release will be taken down to avoid possible issues during competition

posts.name: Tom Winter
posts.cooked: I installed the new elastic version (2025.2.2), and that seems to fix the issues we were having.  Thanks for the fast response on this!
